results.title: Florence
results.creator_credit: Kamina Vincent, Ken Wong and Mountains
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

results.title: Flowergirl
results.creator_credit: Cate Shortland, Anthony Anderson and Red Carpet Productions
results.brief_description: Daisuke, Hana and Tetsu are three young Japanese tourists who share a flat in Sydney’s Bondi Beach. Daisuke has to return to Japan to work in his father’s butcher shop but his return is made bitter because of his falling in love with Hana. Featuring a fragmented narrative utilising video and 16mm film, this beautifully shot short film was voted the Best Short Film of 1999 by the Critic’s Circle of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cate Shortland, Anthony Anderson and Red Carpet Productions

results.title: Floyd on Oz. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: David Pritchard, Pam Stockley, John Chase and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Floyd travels through locations in Australia, meeting people, seeing different sights and cooking dishes in exotic surroundings. In Central Australia he dines on a silver service table on the Adelaide River. In West Australia he creates a piquant sauce for the wife of Australian millionaire, Alan Bond. In the outback Floyd cooks for the Bishop of The Kimberleys. He eats aboriginal food on a bush tucker tour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Pritchard, Pam Stockley, John Chase and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 4
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

This video covers the leadup to the first public look of Florence at PAX Australia 2017 of the first public look of Florence. In it, Mountains reflects on about its reception by the public and the game’s upcoming release.

results.title: Appropriate Harvesting
results.creator_credit: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Under southern skies”.
The critical issue for the next century is how to sustain the productivity of agricultural land without contributing to any further environmental chaos. Sue Henckel investigates 3 different approaches to appropriate farming; a small flower company which harvests wildflowers, a vineyard in the Barossa Valley and a small tropical farm in far north Queensland.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 1
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

In this series of interviews, the developers at Mountains speaks about the studio’s foundation and introduces the staff, describing itself as a ‘craft game studio’. Florence is introduced as a result of this craft, as the studio seeks to create an aesthetically beautiful and moving piece of art, and not simply a game.
